body.name: Edifier W820NB Plus Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones - LDAC Codec - Hi-Res Audio Wireless & Wired - Fast Charge - 49H Playtime - Over Ear Bluetooth V5.2 Headphones- Green
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 14 hrs 13 mins
features: [High Sound Quality] Equipped with a large 1.6 inch (40 mm) mantle plated composite diaphragm sound-pronounced unit that supports LDAC decoding and high resolution, giving you more music details. Transfer speed comparison: LDAC 990Kbps, Qualcomm aptX HD 576Kbps, AAC 512Kbps, SBC 328Kbps.

[-43dB Hybrid Active Noise Cancellation] With the hybrid ANC technology and enclosed design, the headphones will automatically identify ambient noise and transmit the corrected signals. Allows you to enjoy quiet music time in your commute, office, home, or travel.

[Zero Pressure Patent Earcups] The new improved W820NB Plus headphones weigh only 7.9 oz (220 g), and adopts a memory foam cushion material with zero pressure sensation patented technology that gives you a super comfortable wearing experience even with glasses.
[Perfect for Hands-Free Calls] Built-in Mics with DNN (deep neural network) noise cancellation for crystal clear calls.

[Ambient Sound] Supports 7 levels of ambient sound volume, allowing you to hear outside sound more clearly when you need it. No worry about missing important information, nor the bus or airport broadcasts, vehicle reminders, etc.
[49-Hour Playback Time] A full charge will give you 49 hours of playback time while a quick 10-minute fast charge will give you 7 hours of non-stop use.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Previous page 10 Minutes = 7 Hours Get 7 hours of playback time from a single 10-minute fast charge. Next page 1 LDAC Audio 2 Immersive Sound 3 -43dB Hybrid ANC 4 40mm Dynamic Driver 5 Fast Charging

Crystal-Clear Calls The deep neural network noise canceling technology ensures more explicit calls that work even in the busiest and most bustle street. Up to 49 Hours of Playback Time Get up to 33 hours of uninterrupted music while on noise-cancelling mode and 49 hours on standard mode. Ambient Sound With ambient sound mode on, you can listen to music and stay aware of your surroundings. Stay up to date while on the move, whether at the airport or in the subway. Lightweight and Comfort Design The super soft headband and ear pads are comfortable for everyday use. Find the perfectly snug fit by simply using the adjustable headband.

Edifier Connect App Connect your W820NB Plus Headphones to the Edifier Connect app for additional features. With options such as personalized EQ, shutdown timer, power display, prompt volume and soothing sounds, you are bound to fall in love with music all over again. Game Mode Get a latency as low as 0.08s while enjoying synchronized visual and audio in game mode. Get deep in the game and retain your number 1 status.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great performance, great value
reviews.reviewText: I am a loyal Edifier fan due to the performance and value of their products. I got these primarily for the LDAC capability, which works flawlessly with no latency issues, even at distances over 20ft.Pros: Comfy, light, easy to use controls, easy connectivity, good appCons: no manual eq, only settings are ambient sound and noise canceling, not foldable/compactGreat for calls and music in a quieter setting. Noise canceling is great, but obviously effects sound signature.*Note: For sound rating, I am comparing to higher-end hps and also considering the lack of a neutral mode.These are excellent value and performance as I said. If you are looking for LDAC capable hps with noise cancellation these are probably the best, and from an established name. Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Work great for the money
reviews.reviewText: These definitely are not your typical top of the line $200+ pair of head sets, but they definitely work great.I refuse to pay for the top of the line headsets because I really don't need that type of quality.They do cancel out noise well. Very comfortable given they have the larger ear pieces that cover my ears which I can wear longer periods of time and my ears not hurt. Ive actually fallen asleep in them.Really good battery life for sure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great for people with normal-sized heads
reviews.reviewText: My head is slightly too small for most headphones, so they can't create the seal around my ears needed to make the noise cancelling effective. When I press the headphones against my head, they are pretty good at noise cancelling. They're no bose of course, but I'd say if normal volume is at 100%, they cancel noise down to like 50%. I'm a bit picky when it comes to noise cancelling due to sensory issues but these are affordable enough that there's no reason to try and return them. They are comfortable, turn on quickly and default to your last noise cancelling setting. My one complaint is that in order to be able to turn off ambient noise, you need to download the edifier app. Without the app, the two settings are ambient and noise cancelling, you need the app to just turn them both off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome NC Headphones For the Price
reviews.reviewText: I bought these for my autistic son after buying myself a pair. I was looking for something less expensive since he's at the age where he doesn't take care of things yet. Surprisingly these are actually better than the more expensive pair I bought for myself. They are also SO comfortable. That was the most important part because he's so sensitive to anything touching his ears but when he tried them on and I asked if they were comfortable he said "YEAH!" with a big smile on his face. I bought other ones that were specifically for kids that I had to return because they were not comfortable at all. So glad I bought these for him because they seem durable and he will actually wear them because of how comfortable they are. Also, the Noise Cancelling is much better than expected. I tried them on myself to test them out and I can still hear talking but it cancels out all of the bothersome noise, which is what we wanted them for.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A Mix, But Not Bad Overall
reviews.reviewText: I use these headphones primarily to listen to music and videos on a Windows 11 laptop. My first impression of the Edifiers is very mixed. They initially felt a bit tight on my middle-sized head, but after a short amount of wearing they are still snug, but a bit more comfortable. They stay in place well enough, but they don’t feel especially heavy or light. The ear pads are large and block a significant amount of ambient sound. They can get pretty warm after a short time, but not unbearably so. I can easily listen for an hour or so without significant discomfort. The build feels adequate, but not luxurious or bulletproof. The product description indicates that these are not foldable, but my ear pieces fold flat. The various joints are fairly sloppy, and the entirely plastic headband loses adjustment easily. This is my first experience with noise canceling. The effect is noticeable and pleasant, but not dramatic. Low frequencies are pretty well masked, higher frequencies not as much. Noise canceling is not as important to me as sound quality. The sound quality is good enough for my purposes, but not spectacular. On first listen, the sound seemed somewhat more processed than natural, and a bit thin and flat. From other reviews I knew they wouldn’t be bass heavy, which for me is a good thing. After a 4-5 hours of use, they seem to have gotten better. I haven’t used them enough to speak to full battery life, which is now at 80%. I usually use iTunes for playing my large music collection, and using the built-in iTunes equalizer makes a big difference. The presets are surprisingly good, and they make the Edifiers sound much better. It’s a bit of a pain to add another step, but the improvement is worth it. The sound when listening to speech on videos is good enough, but on some videos, I can sometimes detect a little latency. There is a game mode, but I couldn’t tell the difference. Pairing was easy, and the Bluetooth range a bit better than some of my other devices. After a day or two with no problems, I now sometimes get brief, random dropouts. I don’t know whether to blame the headphones, or interference from some other device. I can’t pin it down. A USB C to A charging cable is included, but not a charger. The buttons feel okay, but are not prominent enough, or differentiated enough, and they are spaced too close together for my large, numb fingers. I wish it had a dedicated power switch instead of a multi-function button that has to be held down to turn the power on or off. The power and ANC controls would be better on the left side. I don’t use the headphones with my iPhone, or use them to take calls, so I can’t speak to those functions.Now for the really unforgivable stuff: The included instructions are totally lacking, and in tiny print on a pamphlet made for very small ants. The downloadable pdf version is more readable, but not very helpful. I suppose the assumption is that you'll be using the app on your phone. It's inexcusable that there is no app alternative for Windows, and some of the settings and options are simply unavailable to PC users. Among other unavailable options there is supposed to be a "Standard" mode along with the Ambient, ANC and Game modes; the instructions provide no information as to what that even is. Also missing is whatever passes for an equalizer, and a battery status indicator. The manual makes no reference to it, but I found that battery status can be found in Windows under the settings for Bluetooth devices. Also totally ignored in the manual is the meaning of the various flashing blue LED patterns that come and go. In the manual for another model I found that they are likely Bluetooth status indicators, but the patterns don't really match this model. No clues on the Edifier site. Completely missing is any sort of indication as to whether the power is on or off. Sometimes the blue lights flash, sometimes they don't. This is where a dedicated two-position power switch would be very helpful. And it would avoid having to hold the power button down to turn the device on or off. The ANC is always enabled by default when powering on, instead of remembering the last used setting - that’s annoying and should be optional. How smart would a designer have to be to figure all this out? From what I understand, the phone app is a thinly veiled ad for other products and is likely to be a privacy issue. That trend is certainly unforgivable, and would be very unwelcome in a Windows app. I have little to compare these headphones with, except some older LG neckband earbuds, which sound much worse, and some even older wired Sennheiser P100 lightweight on-ear headphones, which sound a bit better and more natural. Despite the really stupid stuff listed above, the Edifiers are probably as good as I’ll get for the price. If they don’t break, I can recommend them for casual listening to music and video. For the $55 sale price, I probably could have done worse, and, at the moment, I’m planning to keep them. They’d be 4 stars except for the stupid stuff, and especially the functions lost without the app.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Okay honestly I just got this product today and currently I'm using the voice to text and it seems to be working surprisingly well and the audio sounds really good I haven't tested out if there is any leakage yet when I'm listening to music but I will at school tomorrow. This headphone is honestly so comfortable and it fits really nice on my small head and I love it Yes it doesn't fold and it does not come with a carrying case but it is small enough and comfortable enough to wear it can hang around your neck and like the sides fold inwards like in the first picture. I like that this has an ambient feature and it has noise cancellation both work really well and I both like them they sound really nice and it has a USBC charger which is really convenient. Overall these are the best headphones that I have bought and I'm so glad I bought them and not anything else more expensive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Edifier W820 NB Plus Bluetooth headphones
reviews.reviewText: Very solid quality with a premium feel and excellent sound quality that is above more expensive brands. Easy to use buttons and easy to sync with phone / mp player.Comes with usb c charger lead but wish it came with usb c to 3.5mm jack plug also, and no indication of left or right side (apparently the right ear speaker is the side with the buttons)
Toutes les prions d’un casque haut de gamme, réduction de bruit, BT, fonction appel, autonomie, confort sur les oreilles et son de bonne qualité, à ce prix il a tout d’un grand, livraison rapide

Sounds great, but there are some short comings.1. Not foldable, plus there's no case to keep it protected during travel.2. Volume is pretty low. I find myself using it at full volume many times.3. No multi point connect feature. It could be a deal breaker for many of the people using more than one device.If you're using it at your desk with only one device, it's an amazing option. But not otherwise.
